issue.title: [CF 974] [Beta] A Few Bugs
issue.body:
1) Sometimes the checkboxes will all stack on top of each other. Closing and reopening the config window will make it fix itself, though.
http://puu.sh/anzI8/26a62b563a.jpg

2) The 'hand' of the timer swing is yellow and more pronounced
http://puu.sh/anzK9/88c327005c.jpg beta
http://puu.sh/anzPN/ffd1444901.jpg live
(Ignore the empty timer swing on the left, that icon is manually set to blank)

3) In WOD, there are 3 raid difficulties/sizes. LFR (25 players), normal and heroic (which are flexible for 10-25 players). and mythic (20 players). Might want to rearrange some of the categories.
http://puu.sh/anzT5/79bdbb7328.jpg
http://puu.sh/anzZm/6e79156f10.jpg

4) Not so much a bug, but it may be. Trying to make a working spell cooldown aura for Gladiator Stance's "Shield Charge" ability. For some reason the aura won't show up as it should. When I try to track a similar ability (charge with the Double Time talent), it tracks perfectly fine, so it has to be something with this ability specifically (and as such might be on Blizzard's end). I've tried tracking by naming it Shield Charge, Shield Block (the ability shield charge replaces by spec'ing into glad stance), and by setting the exact spell ID.
http://pastebin.com/bQYhynRS

E: I got the aura to work by making the icon the exact spell ID of Shield Block (2565). Unsure if this is an error with TMW requiring the exact ID of the ability that was replaced for a spell cooldown of this type, or something buggy on Blizzard's end.

5) Certain auras in my setup repeatedly delete themself upon a relog.
http://puu.sh/anApn/8463a00e9b.jpg (check the two Colossus Smash auras in the top left group)
http://puu.sh/anAqN/61bdbc5108.jpg (after relog, both auras are now gone)

http://pastebin.com/dkSPg0Lu for my setup if you want to test it. Won't have global auras (unless you changed that they are exported too, now) so if you want I can un-global them and reupload the export.

6) The game will lag/freeze when typing in the 'Choose spell(s) to check' and 'Custom Texture' boxes. There're also some green boxes for the Layout Settings/Copy buttons and the resize handle, but I'm sure you know that.

7) Not a bug but more of a suggestion, in the short time using WeakAuras before you had pushed a beta version, they have an option for each aura for a 'zoom', which is nice as it allows you to zoom in past the border textures, making the icon look much cleaner. Might be a nice feature to add that can be put on an icon/group/global level for people who want a cleaner look w/o using something like Masque.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy | Imported from CurseForge issue #974 | Raw

comments.body:
http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/repositories/warlords/files/57-7-0-2-34-ga4b515c/

Using that version, I forgot to add.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

2) Yeah, I need to bring back the option to toggle that. Blizzard removed it for a time and nobody knows why, but at least its back.

3) Just did that last night, but forgot to push. It's done now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

5) I think this image speaks for itself: http://i.imgur.com/Ts7WqCp.png

I made a thread, and sent the thread to Blizzard: http://www.wowinterface.com/forums/showthread.php?p=294284#post294284

To prevent it from happening for now, just enable all the blank, unconfigured icons in that group.

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

6) Rewrote suggestion list sorting for gfdde296


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

2) Added the setting to toggle that back in for gfbb3d36


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

1) Do you have any reliable steps to reproduce this issue? I can't seem to reproduce it myself.

7) I'll leave that to Masque.

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

It happens intermittently for me, and fixes itself on the first attempt of closing and reopening the window. If I narrow it down I'll let you know, though.

E: Also, every time I start up the beta, I get this readout from TMW.

http://pastebin.com/AjUNui3h

E2: http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/repositories/warlords/files/60-7-0-2-39-gfbb3d36/

In gfbb3d36, timer swings will hook themselves to option with the 'show timer text' option enabled, even if they don't have 'show timer' enabled.

http://puu.sh/aohHV/d36936b34c.jpg

http://puu.sh/aohKT/52c2fe4b8b.jpg

Also, the frame skipping/lag when typing in custom texture/spell boxes is still persistent.

(Do you want me to keep reporting successive build bugs in this thread, or make a new ticket per build as necessary?)

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

You can keep using this one until I close it.

I added some debug ouput in gc7f7d20 that will help debug the stacked checkbox issue. I saw it once, but I still can't pinpoint it. I know enough that the debug output should help, though.

I haven't gotten to updating equivs - ignore that for now.

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Don't bother with the debug output yet - its still a bit overbearing on when it reports itself. Let me refine it a bit more.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Ok, in the process of refining the output I figured out the issue and fixed it. So, yay!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Fixed the cooldown sweep issue in gc57d894.

When you say that the lag with the suggestion list is still happening, how is it manifesting itself?

What does it feel like if you walk around while typing at the same time? Does it just drop your framerate? Or does it lock up for a second or two? Also, does it happen no matter what, or does it only happen when you only have typed 1 or 2 characters into the editbox?

Delete your TellMeWhen_Options.lua SavedVariables and see if it still does it.

If you are able to record a short video if it while walking around, that would be awesome.

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Locks up for a few seconds, happens no matter what.

I'll delete the options + make a quick vod of it on my stream in a bit (doing 3s on live atm).


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Actually, I'm almost certain that it is TellMeWhen_Options.lua.

If you installed that version that you linked me in the PM that you sent me, then that's it for sure. You will be able to tell because the file will be around 12MB in size if its broken. It got filled up with junk data from that version you used, and so every time you type, the suggestion list has to search through 12MB of data.

So don't bother with the video if that fixes it. I put an upgrade in to delete that automatically, but I managed to screw it up, so it never actually deleted it.

So actually, disregard everything I just said, and just install the latest version, which is now gfaa16d2 gfed8890 because I absolutely screwed up gfaa16d2.

Edited Jul 23, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I did install the version I linked you, but the last report I gave you was from one of your versions. I'll try installing the newest ver. and you're probably right.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Yeah, its just that the bad data persisted, and when I thought I put in code to clean it up, well... I actually didn't. But its there now!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
